title: 107_hr2558
content: The Act titled "Teacher Voluntary Early Retirement Incentive Act of 2001" establishes voluntary early retirement incentive plans for governmental and higher education employees. The Act "Teacher Voluntary Early Retirement Incentive Act of 2001" establishes voluntary early retirement incentive plans for governmental and higher education employees, allowing for supplemental benefits based on age at retirement under certain conditions. The Act "Teacher Voluntary Early Retirement Incentive Act of 2001" allows for supplemental benefits for employees who meet specific criteria, including a minimum age requirement and a 180-day retirement election period. The Act allows for supplemental benefits for eligible employees, ensuring those not eligible due to age had a prior opportunity. The amendment applies to early retirement plans in educational agencies and institutions, determining compliance with age discrimination laws after January 1, 1996. SEC. 3. Retiree medical benefits coordinated with Medicare and other governmental and employer benefit plans; voluntary early retirement incentive plans maintained by local educational agencies. (a) Voluntary Early Retirement Incentive Plans Maintained by Local Educational Agencies.--Section 4(l)(1) of the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967 is amended to include voluntary early retirement plans maintained by local educational agencies in coordination with defined benefit plans. (b) Retiree Medical Benefits Coordinated With Medicare Benefits.--Section 4(l) of the Act is amended to clarify that it is not a violation for an employee benefit plan to coordinate retiree medical benefits with Medicare benefits. The amendment to the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967 clarifies that it is not a violation for employee benefit plans to alter medical benefits for retired participants when they become eligible for Medicare benefits. The amendments also apply to voluntary early retirement plans maintained by local educational agencies. The amendment to the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967 clarifies that altering medical benefits for retired participants does not violate the Act. It also addresses voluntary early retirement plans maintained by local educational agencies.
